news.title: Veegaland Developers files papers with Sebi for ₹250-crore IPO
news.para: Veegaland Developers, part of V-Guard, is set to launch its Initial Public Offering, aiming to secure Rs 250 crore through a fresh equity issue. The investment will fuel various projects, facilitate land acquisitions, and cater to overall corporate requirements.

news.title: Karnataka Housing Board warns public against illegal site sales in Bengaluru
news.para: The Karnataka Housing Board has issued a clear caution regarding site purchases in Suryanagar Phase-4. Acquiring plots through selection letters is considered illegal. These letters are strictly designated for landowners and do not convey any rights for transfer.

news.title: Residential sales growth to remain steady at 10-12% over next two fiscals: ICRA
news.para: Residential real estate developers are eyeing a promising outlook with anticipated sales growth between 10-12% for this and the following financial year. The driving forces behind this optimism include decreased interest rates paired with improved housing affordability.

news.title: India office leasing holds steady at 75.2 million sq ft in 2025: Report
news.para: The year-end of 2025 saw India's office market thriving, achieving a remarkable 75.2 million sq ft in gross leasing amongst six major urban centers. Leading the charge were Bengaluru, Delhi-NCR, and Mumbai, spurred on by a wave of international firms and enhanced global capabilities.

news.title: Premium home prices rise up to 36% across cities in 2025, led by under-construction projects: Report
news.para: In 2025, the luxury real estate sector in India thrived, witnessing remarkable price surges particularly in urban centers. This upward trend was driven by a wave of fresh developments and enhanced connectivity initiatives. Additionally, the upswing in rental rates mirrored the purchase price boom.

news.title: Delhi-NCR office occupancy to cross 80% by FY27: ICRA
news.para: The office landscape in Delhi NCR is experiencing a robust transformation, with occupancy rates anticipated to surge dramatically by March 2027. The IT and consulting industries are fueling a leasing boom, while pre-leasing activity hints at sustained vigor despite new developments.

news.title: Lower home loan rates improve housing affordability across most cities in 2025: Knight Frank
news.para: Home loan interest rates are falling, making homes more affordable across India in 2025. Ahmedabad, Pune, and Kolkata lead as the most affordable cities. Mumbai also sees improved affordability, breaking a key stress threshold.

news.title: Flexible workspace stock to cross 100 million sq ft by 2027: Report
news.para: The flexible workspace landscape in India is set to flourish, with expectations that total office space will surpass 100 million sq ft by 2027. The growth trajectory is largely influenced by enterprise and GCC demands. Leading the charge are Bengaluru and Delhi-NCR, followed closely by Pune's robust market share.

news.title: Pune records over 14,000 property registrations in November 2025
news.para: Pune's property market saw a significant rise in November 2025. Residential registrations increased by 6 percent year-on-year. Stamp duty collections also grew by 19 percent. Homes up to one crore rupees continue to dominate.

news.title: Ceramic tile makers to bake 4-5% revenue rebound in FY26: Crisil
news.para: India's ceramic tile market is on the brink of a promising boom. Forecasts indicate a significant uptick in revenue for this fiscal year and the next, primarily propelled by a strong residential real estate demand. The shift towards premium tile varieties is likely to elevate profit margins.

news.title: Home registrations in Hyderabad jump 25% in November 2025: Knight Frank
news.para: In November 2025, Hyderabad's  residential property registrations experienced a 25% year-on-year increase, marking the year’s peak in monthly activity. The transaction value saw an impressive 40% uptick, largely fueled by a robust interest in luxury properties.

news.title: Cement volumes to expand by 6-7% in FY2027: ICRA
news.para: The Indian cement industry is poised for robust growth, with volumes expected to surge by 6.5-7.5% in FY2026 and maintain a steady increase of 6-7% in FY2027. This growth is primarily fueled by soaring demands in housing and infrastructure development.

news.title: Private equity investments in Indian real estate rise 59% to $6.7 billion in 2025: Savills India
news.para: Private equity investment in Indian real estate saw a significant jump in 2025, reaching $6.7 billion. Foreign investors led the capital deployment, showing sustained interest. The office sector attracted the most investment, followed by data centres and residential properties.

news.title: CapitaLand India Trust to divest 20.2% stake in three data centres for ₹702 crore
news.para: CapitaLand India Trust has chosen to sell a segment of its interest in three developing data centres. This enables the trust to channel resources into new ventures. The acquisition is being made by an emerging data centre fund.

news.title: Gurugram civic body seals seven properties over ₹1.8 crore tax dues
news.para: Municipal Corporation of Gurugram sealed seven properties, recovering Rs 1.8 crore in overdue property taxes. This action, part of a broader campaign, aims to fund essential civic amenities. Officials emphasized that strict measures will persist against defaulters, urging prompt tax payments to avoid penalties.

news.title: Lucknow development body razes 12 illegal sites in Gudamba and Kakori
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) demolished 12 construction sites across 43.75 acres in illegal colonies in Gudamba and Kakori. Enforcement teams targeted boundary walls and site offices in Kapasi village, Gudamba, and eight plots in Jaliyamau, Kathingra, Fatehganj, and Nathora villages, Kakori. The LDA continues its crackdown on unauthorized development.

news.title: KMC can repair unsafe buildings caught in civil dispute: Calcutta HC
news.para: The Calcutta High Court ruled that civil disputes cannot halt the renovation of a dilapidated building declared unsafe by KMC. The court emphasized the substantial risk to residents and the public, directing owners and a petitioner to jointly apply for a sanction plan for renovation within a fortnight.

news.title: Retail leasing to hit nine million sq ft in 2025 on mall-led recovery: Cushman & Wakefield
news.para: India’s retail real estate market is set to record its highest post-pandemic leasing at about nine million sq ft in 2025, driven by a strong year-end surge as new Grade A mall supply becomes operational. Improved availability of quality space has unlocked pent-up demand, while a robust supply pipeline is expected to push retail leasing further in 2026.

news.title: Yasmin Karachiwala buys two apartments worth ₹37.5 crore in Bandra West, Mumbai
news.para: Fitness trainer Yasmin Karachiwala has purchased two luxury ocean-facing apartments in Bandra West. The properties are valued at Rs 37.5 crore. Karachiwala, who trains Bollywood stars, invested in the elite Superstar-Signature Edition project. She also encouraged her niece to buy a flat in the same development. The project offers advanced wellness amenities.

news.title: Same apartment, multiple sale agreements shocks buyers in Bengaluru
news.para: Homebuyers are facing distress as builders repeatedly sell identical flats, exposing regulatory loopholes and alleged corruption in sub-registrar offices. Financial institutions are also failing to conduct mandatory due diligence. Despite discrepancies in carpet area, sub-registrar offices are registering multiple sale agreements for the same property, leaving innocent buyers defrauded.
